result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L Hines

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael L Hines in court.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Michael L Hines.  Attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer E. Benson. State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 02. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report-10-25-2022

Defendant Michael L Hines in court in person.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Michael L Hines.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-23-2022

Defendant Michael L Hines appeared by video, in court.  Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision ( VIOLATION) Report; filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Verizon (Mayfair Mall); Mayfair Mall

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michael L Hines in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael L Hines in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael L Hines appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Michael L Hines not in court.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@02:30pm
